titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: William Woart Lancaster (b. 1874) was a partner in the law firm Shearman, Sterling & Wright. He was Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Foreign Policy Association. He also served as Vice-Chairman of the Board of Directors of the American-Russian Institute and the Secretary of the American Society for Russian Relief, Inc.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence, memos, and "day notes" of William Lancaster. "Day notes" include Lancaster's daily schedules and typed summaries of selected activities. Correspondence relates to Lancaster's business activities in international trade, as well as his interest in the political relations between the U.S.S.R. and the United States, and, more broadly, between the U.S.S.R. and the West. The collection includes reports on the efforts of the American Friends Service Committee to improve relations between the U.S. and the U.S.S.R. Many of the letters in the collection reveal Lancaster's role as a liaison between American Friends Service Committee members and various political figures.

controlaccess.subject: Society of Friends and world politics.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
